Pros:
None.

Cons:
Survivors will consistently have their perks and abilities nerfed.
Devs cannot be bothered to come up with new killers; instead they acquire rights to movie villains.
Lack of new maps.
In-game store filled with useless cosmetics.  I suspect this is where all the money the game makes is spent, since the maps and gameplay haven't improved since release.
Community is toxic.  Killers will create thread after thread after thread about how survivors need to be nerfed.  Survival rate for survivors: less than 30%.
Moderation of threads is ridiculous.  Being warned not "to be slowy" (still trying to figure out what that means...) when responding to killers with numerous VAC bans.

Summary:
You get a survivor that has 3 initial perks.  You play as or purchase other survivors with different perks.  If your perks assist you in surviving via out-benefits or meta improvements, expect a nerf.

Decisive Strike?  Nerfed.

Mettle of Men?  Nerfed.

Borrowed Time?  Nerfed.

Over and over again.  Meanwhile, the killer community relies on 2 or 3 standard perks (out of 4 allowed total) that haven't seen a change more or less since release.

The recent update (End Game Collapse) further removes the hatch escape option by allowing the killers to close and lock the hatch.

The killer community expects the survivors to "play stealth," and yet recent test server updates including brighter clothing and lighting for the survivors, this ensuring that stealth will be even less of an option than it is now.

So if you like shoddy game development, garbage maps, creatively-lacking killers, whiny trust-fund-kid-level entitlement from the killers, and consistent/predictable nerfs, this game is for you.

Otherwise, avoid this game and developer.  Your money would be better spent paying a drunken hobo to punch you repeatedly in the junk.

You have been banned from the Dead by Daylight Hub until Jun 18 @ 2:47am.
You have been banned by a forum moderator.
Reason: "You recently just had a warning. Take a week off and don't talk so slowy about people."

I ask myself,"What does this mean?  How does someone talk "slowy?""  And then I look at the game and realize if the developers can't be tasked with doing something right, the moderators can't either.

Then I shake my head and walk the hell away before the disease stemming from DbD becomes contagious.

Dead by Daylight is a multiplayer (4vs1) horror game where one player takes on the role of the savage Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors, trying to escape the Killer and avoid being caught and killed.

In my opinion this game is a lot of fun...ofc there are a lot of down-sides to the game, but all in all its a pretty fun game, if you want to have some fun with your friends you should give it a try and see if you can survive.

Things I like about the game:
Seeing my improvement after every game
Juking the Killer
Hiding
Flashlightsaving

Down-sides:
Campers -make the game boring-
People who use lagswitches
People who slug

Thrilling, Engaging, very fun to play with friends or solo as a killer.

Sadly after almost 3k hours the devs continue to ignore the community (of long term players especially) and the most recent changes to UI and movement has been the straw that broke the camels back for a lot of people, myself included. 

The game is a fantastic concept and when it works is extremely fun, hence the amount of time a lot of us have in it, but sadly it's let down time and time again by a dev team that are too stubborn for their own good and are so out of touch with their core player base that it's painful to watch now. 

Shame to see what it has become.
